Stress Buster Tip:  Accept the things you can't change.  Try to concentrate on the things you do have control over.
Stress Buster Tip:  Try To Be Positive.  Look for the positives in life, and things for which you're grateful.
Stress Buster Tip:  Work smarter, not harder.  Prioritize your work, concentrating on tasks that will make a real difference.
Stress Buster Tip:  Help Other People.  People who help others through activities such as volunteering, become more resilient.
Stress Buster Tip:  Avoid Unhealthy Habits.  Don't rely on alcohol, smoking & caffeine for ways of coping.  Develop healthy coping skills.
Stress Buster Tip:  Challenge Yourself.  Setting yourself goals and challenges, whether at work or outside, helps to build confidence.

column1: Stress Buster Tip - Pop a piece of gum. Chewing loosens your jaw, where you often store stress.
Stress Buster Tip - Sit up straight. When your shoulders are back, you open up your chest and breathe more freely.
Stress Buster Tip - Hang your head forward as if it were a heavy ball, then move it slowly to the side, back, side and front.
Stress Buster Tip - Sing a favorite song. You'll breathe more fully and the increased oxygen will do your body good.
Stress Buster Tip - Copy a cat! Stretch and then shake it out.
Stress Buster Tip - Take three deep breaths-5 seconds in, 5 seconds out-to slow your heart rate and the pace of your stress hormones.

column1: He gives twice who gives promptly." Publilius Syrus"

Kindness is in our power

column1: Wise sayings often fall on barren ground

column1: Without kindness

column1: There is nothing in life but refraining from hurting others

column1: Knowing sorrow well

e jealous are troublesome to others, but torment to themselves. William Penn"

Happiness is not a matter of events

We cannot hold a torch to light anothers path without brightening our own. Ben Sweetland
Happiness is a by-product of helping others. Denny Miller
No one can sincerely try to help another without helping himself. Charles Dudley Warner

Stress Buster Tip:  Accept the things you can't change.  Try to concentrate on the things you do have control over.
Stress Buster Tip:  Try To Be Positive.  Look for the positives in life, and things for which you're grateful.
Stress Buster Tip:  Work smarter, not harder.  Prioritize your work, concentrating on tasks that will make a real difference.
Stress Buster Tip:  Help Other People.  People who help others through activities such as volunteering, become more resilient.
Stress Buster Tip:  Avoid Unhealthy Habits.  Don't rely on alcohol, smoking & caffeine for ways of coping.  Develop healthy coping skills.
Stress Buster Tip:  Challenge Yourself.  Setting yourself goals and challenges, whether at work or outside, helps to build confidence.
Stress Buster Tip:  Connect with people.  A good support network of colleagues, friends and family can ease your stress thru communication.
Stress Buster Tip:  Take control.  Taking control is empowering.  The feeling of loss of control is one of the main causes of stress.
Stress Buster Tip:  Exercise.  It will reduce some of the emotional intensity that you're feeling.  You'll deal with problems more calmly.

The Birman has a long, soft, almost silky single coat. The thickness will vary with seasonal conditions.
The Birman is a medium to medium-large longhaired pointed cat with distinctive white gloves and laces.
With love, good food, fond grooming, & proper health care, the Birman makes the greatest buddy, friend, confidant, & all around purrfect pet
The Birman is a great family cat. It dwells peacefully within a single cat home or a home with many cat friends. #cat #feline #pet

Stress Buster Tip:  Accept the things you can't change.  Try to concentrate on the things you do have control over.
Stress Buster Tip:  Try To Be Positive.  Look for the positives in life, and things for which you're grateful.
Stress Buster Tip:  Work smarter, not harder.  Prioritize your work, concentrating on tasks that will make a real difference.
Stress Buster Tip:  Help Other People.  People who help others through activities such as volunteering, become more resilient.
Stress Buster Tip:  Avoid Unhealthy Habits.  Don't rely on alcohol, smoking & caffeine for ways of coping.  Develop healthy coping skills.
Stress Buster Tip:  Challenge Yourself.  Setting yourself goals and challenges, whether at work or outside, helps to build confidence.
Stress Buster Tip:  Connect with people.  A good support network of colleagues, friends and family can ease your stress thru communication.
Stress Buster Tip:  Take control.  Taking control is empowering.  The feeling of loss of control is one of the main causes of stress.
Stress Buster Tip:  Exercise.  It will reduce some of the emotional intensity that you're feeling.  You'll deal with problems more calmly.
Before deciding that a certain dog is right for you, you must make an honest assessment as to whether your home is right for any #dog .
Dog ownership is not something to be entered into lightly. Owning a dog is a long-term emotional and financial commitment.
If you are considering taking a dog into your life, you need to think seriously about the commitment that dog ownership entails.
Among companion animals, dogs are unmatched in their devotion, loyalty and friendship to humankind.
Owning a dog is not just a privilege-it's a responsibility. These animals depend on us for, at minimum, food & shelter & deserve much more.
Though independent in spirit, Tibetan Spaniels are naturally clean and easily trained. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel enjoys cuddling up and keeping you warm, nestling on soft pillows or clean laundry.
The Tibetan Spaniel enjoys any high lookout such as a windowsill from which to survey their territory.
In one compact package, the Tibetan Spaniel is both excellent watch dog and very good bed dog.
Neither nervous nor hyper, a Tibetan Spaniel is like a large dog in a small body. #canine #animal #dog
The Tibetan Spaniel will vigorously alert you to any unusual event or arrival, yet, they do not bark unnecessarily.

Tibetan Spaniels are very sensitive little dogs
Tibetan Spaniels are small
column2: well-balanced dogs

column4: intelligent appearance."

column1: The Tibetan Spaniel is calm and confident, they're a shrewd choice for those looking for a manageable small dog with big-dog temperament.
The Tibetan Spaniel are long-lived, adaptable companions who form an almost worshipful bond with their humans. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel is a small breed and has a lifespan of 13 to 15 years. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel has a double coat and needs weekly brushing. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel needs only moderate exercise, so they are excellent in apartments. #dog #canine #animal
Although outgoing and friendly, the Tibetan Spaniel may be aloof with strangers. #dog #canine #animal
A very intelligent breed, the Tibetan Spaniel thrives on human companionship and needs to be with people. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel is self-confident, bright, loving and playful in personality. #dog #animal #canine

column1: Stress Buster Tip - Pop a piece of gum. Chewing loosens your jaw, where you often store stress.
Stress Buster Tip - Sit up straight. When your shoulders are back, you open up your chest and breathe more freely.
Stress Buster Tip - Hang your head forward as if it were a heavy ball, then move it slowly to the side, back, side and front.
Stress Buster Tip - Sing a favorite song. You'll breathe more fully and the increased oxygen will do your body good.
Stress Buster Tip - Copy a cat! Stretch and then shake it out.
Stress Buster Tip - Take three deep breaths-5 seconds in, 5 seconds out-to slow your heart rate and the pace of your stress hormones.

column3: we'd still be eating frozen radio dinners." Johnny Carson"

column1: Love is like the measles

I love on a one-way street that's also a dead end. I'm not sure how I got there." Steven Wright"
What would be ugly in a garden constitutes beauty in a mountain." Victor Hugo"
The task of art today is to bring chaos into order." Theodor Adorno"
If you don't love me
column2: it does not matter
column3: anyway I can love for both of us." Stendhal"

column1: Without labor nothing prospers." Sophocles"
Happiness is not a matter of intensity but of balance
column2: order
column3: rhythm and harmony." Thomas Merlon"

column1: If a cluttered desk is the sign of a cluttered mind
column2: what is the significance of a clean desk?" Laurence J. Peter"

column1: In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer." Albert Camus"
Of what use were the arts if they were only the reproduction and the imitation of life?" Alfred de Vigny"
Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a man's last romance." Oscar Wilde"
Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven." Henry Ward Beecher"
Don't forget to love yourself." Soren Kierkegaard"
Start every day off with a smile and get it over with." W. C. Fields"
Words
column2: like nature
column3: half reveal and half conceal the soul within." Alfred Lord Tennyson"

column1: A great artist can paint a great picture on a small canvas." Charles Dudley Warner"
The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life
column2: the clearer we should see through it." Jean Paul"

column1: Good
column2: better
column3: best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best." St. Jerome"

column1: Nature never makes any blunders
column2: when she makes a fool she means it." Archibald Alexander"

column1: Contrast is what makes photography interesting." Conrad Hall"
Love is the child of illusion and the parent of disillusion." Miguel de Unamuno"
You can never plan the future by the past." Edmund Burke"
You can't get a cup of tea bit enough or a book long enough to suit me." C.S. Lewis"
What I wanted to do was to paint sunlight on the side of a house." Edward Hopper"
There is a wisdom of the head
column2: and a wisdom of the heart." Charles Dickens"

column1: Instead of giving a politician the keys to the city
column2: it might be better to change the locks." Doug Larson"

column1: Big doesn't necessarily mean better. Sunflowers aren't better than violets." Edna Ferber"
Art is making something out of nothing and selling it." Frank Zappa"
Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence." Erich From"
Never go on trips with anyone you do not love." Ernest Hemingway"
A wide screen just makes a bad film twice as bad." Samuel Goldwyn"
I belive in God
column2: only I spell it Nature." Frank Lloyd Wright"

column1: I cry out for order and find it only in art." Helen Hayes"
A mixture of admiration and pity is one of the surest recipes for affection." Arthur Helps"
It is never too late to be what you might have been." George Eliot"
Destiny has two ways of crushing us - by refusing our wishes and by fulfilling them." Henri Frederic Amiel"
It's amazing how a competitive nature can turn a negative into something positive." Barry Mann"
A buoyant
column2: positive approach to the game is as basic as a sound wing." Tony Lema"

column1: You have to be positive
column2: and I'm not just talking about athletics
column3: this also applies to life." Sheryl Swoopes"

column1: I have to think of the positive
I have never won a race
column2: and that is my main disappointment - but you have to be positive." Jean Alesi"

column1: Positive thinking will let you do everything bettter than negative thinking will." Zig Ziglar"
Correction does much
column2: but encouragement does more." Johann Wolfgang von Goethe"

column1: Positive anything is better than negative nothing." Elbert Hubbard"
Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shawdow." Helen Keller"
Yesterday is not ours to recover
column2: but tomorrow is ours to win or lose." Lyndon B. Johnson"

column1: To expect too much is to have a sentimental view of life and this is a softness that ends in bitterness." Flannery O'Connor"
I'm a romantic
I love being married. It's so great to find that one special person you want to annoy for the rest of your life." Rita Rudner"
I consider myself a crayon
column2: I might not be your favorite color but one day you'll need me to complete your picture." Savannah Highnote"

column1: Never let a fool kiss you
column2: or a kiss fool you." Joey Adams"

column1: The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits." Albert Einstein"
All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." Charles M. Schulz"
The road to success is always under construction." Lily Tomlin"
The great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do." Walter Bagehot"
For the best seat in the house
column2: you'll have to move the dog." Unknown"

column1: A mind is like a parachute. It doesn't work if it is not open." Frank Zappa"
Be yourself
The present
column2: like a note in music
column3: is nothing but as it appertains to what is past and what is to come." Walter Savage Landor"

column1: Past
column2: and to come
column3: seems best

column1: Who controls the past controls the future
Patterns of the past echo in the present and resound through the future." Dhyani Ywahoo"
You are built not to shrink down to less but to blossom into more." Oprah Winfrey"
To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." Ralph Waldo Emerson"
Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance." Samuel Johnson"
He who stops being better stops being good." Oliver Cromwell"
Adversity causes some men to break
It's not the size of the dog in the fight
column2: but the size of the fight in the dog." Archie Griffen"

column1: Inches make champions." Vince Lombardi"
Work is love made visible." Kahlil Gibran"
No great thing is created suddenly." Epictetus"
Well done is better than well said." Ben Franklin"
No wind favors he who has no destined port." Montaigne"
Sometimes even to live is an act of courage." Seneca"
Do first things first
column2: and second things not at all." Peter Drucker"

column1: It's not what you look at that matters
column2: it's what you see." Thoreau"

column1: A clever man commits no minor blunders." Johann Wolfgang von Goethe"
Great ideas often receive violent opposition from mediocre minds." Albert Einstein"
The dumbest people I know are those who know it all." Malcolm Forbes"
The flesh endures the storms of the present alone
column2: the mind those of the past and future as well." Epicurus"

column1: Everyman's life lies within the present
Yesterday is a cancelled check
The past is a bucket of ashes
column2: so live not in your yesterdays
column3: nor just for tomorrow
column4: but to the here and now." Carl Sandberg"

column1: Children have neither a past nor a future. Thus they enjoy the present
column2: which seldom happens to us." Jean de La Bruyere"

column1: With the past
column2: I have nothing to do

column1: The present contains all that there is. It is holy ground

Whether it's the best of times or the worst of times
column2: it's the only time we've got." Art Buchwald"

column1: The word 'now' is like a bomb through the window
column2: and it ticks." Arthur Miller"

column1: He who lives in the present lives in eternity." Ludwig Wittgenstein"

column2: like all times
column3: is a very good one if we but know what to do with it." Ralph Waldo Emerson"

column1: We are here and it is now. Further than this
column2: all knowledge is moonshine." H.L. Mencken"

column1: No mind is such employed upon the present
The cares of today are seldom those of tomorrow." William Cowper"

column1: #Handmade products are made with passion. #Crafters pour their time, talent and passion into everything they make. #art
#Crafting gives us a big-picture view of our history and development as a country and a people.
Many craft artists use their skill to express and share personal and political opinions. #art #craft #crafting
Card making is becoming more and more popular and it's now a novelty to send #handmade #greeting #cards . #stationery #scrapbooking #paper
#Handmade , you cannot compare a mass produced item in terms of inspiration, quality, and attention to detail. #arts #crafts
There is also an element of the designer/producer in every item, a spirit and soul that mainstream production cannot replicate. #handmade
#Handmade : The creation and appreciation of the handmade object is transformative to individuals & communities. #art #craft #hobby
Scrapbooking lets you leave something behind for other people to see. It's in a way like story-telling, except it isn't told but read.

column1: Happinessleads none of us by the same route. Charles Caleb Colton

Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence. Aristotle

Happiness hates the timid! Eugene ONeill
Living well and beautifully and justly are all one thing. Socrates

Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul. Marcus Aurelius

If there is to be any peace it will come through being, not having. Henry Miller
If you do not find peace in yourself you will never find it anywhere else. Paula A. Bendry

Forgiving those who hurt us is the key to personal peace. G. Weatherley

The mind is never right but when it is at peace within itself. Lucius Annaeus Seneca
Peace is not the absence of conflict, but the presence of God no matter what the conflict. Unknown

column1: Most folks are as happy as they make up their minds to be. Abraham Lincoln"
President Washington spent 7 years, 10 months and 27 days in office. #trivia #history
For relaxation, President Washington enjoyed billiards, fox hunting, reading and walking. #trivia #history
President Washington would not shake hands because he thought this beneath the president. He preferred bowing.
Did you know that George Washington added the words so help me God to the presidential oath of office. #trivia #history
Did you know that President Washingtons favorite horse was a white horse named Nelson. #trivia #history #president
George Washington was the first president to appear on a postage stamp. It was the 10 cent stamp , U.S. Post Office, 1847).
Did you know that president Washington wore a size 13 shoe. #trivia #history
Did you know that Washington was the only president to have a state named after him. #trivia #history
Which state is the birthplace of seven presidents? Ohio #trivia #history
Whose inaugural address was the shortest in history? George Washingtons second inaugural address  135 words. #history #trivia
Which three presidents all occupied the office of president during the same year? Van Buren, Harrison and Tyler (1841). #history #trivia
Which president read the entire Bible every year? John Quincy Adams #trivia #history
From which room in the White House did Nixon televise his resignation speech? The Oval Office. #trivia history
How many presidents had the first name James? Six (Madison, Monroe, Polk, Buchanan, Garfield, and Carter). #trivia #history
Which president hosted his daughters senior prom at the White House? Gerald Ford #trivia #history
Who was the first chief executive to fly in an airplane while in office? Franklin D. Roosevelt (1943) #trivia #history
Who was the first president to have been a judge? Andrew Jackson #trivia #history
Who was the only president to have twins? George W. Bush #trivia #history

Who was the tallest president? Abraham Lincoln at six feet four inches tall. #trivia #history

Stress Buster Tip - Pop a piece of gum. Chewing loosens your jaw, where you often store stress.
Stress Buster Tip - Sit up straight. When your shoulders are back, you open up your chest and breathe more freely.
Stress Buster Tip - Hang your head forward as if it were a heavy ball, then move it slowly to the side, back, side and front.
Stress Buster Tip - Sing a favorite song. You'll breathe more fully and the increased oxygen will do your body good.
Stress Buster Tip - Copy a cat! Stretch and then shake it out.
Stress Buster Tip - Take three deep breaths-5 seconds in, 5 seconds out-to slow your heart rate and the pace of your stress hormones.

Stress Buster Tip:  Accept the things you can't change.  Try to concentrate on the things you do have control over.
Stress Buster Tip:  Try To Be Positive.  Look for the positives in life, and things for which you're grateful.
Stress Buster Tip:  Work smarter, not harder.  Prioritize your work, concentrating on tasks that will make a real difference.
Stress Buster Tip:  Help Other People.  People who help others through activities such as volunteering, become more resilient.
Stress Buster Tip:  Avoid Unhealthy Habits.  Don't rely on alcohol, smoking & caffeine for ways of coping.  Develop healthy coping skills.
Stress Buster Tip:  Challenge Yourself.  Setting yourself goals and challenges, whether at work or outside, helps to build confidence.
Stress Buster Tip:  Connect with people.  A good support network of colleagues, friends and family can ease your stress thru communication.
Stress Buster Tip:  Take control.  Taking control is empowering.  The feeling of loss of control is one of the main causes of stress.
Stress Buster Tip:  Exercise.  It will reduce some of the emotional intensity that you're feeling.  You'll deal with problems more calmly.

Though independent in spirit, Tibetan Spaniels are naturally clean and easily trained. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel enjoys cuddling up and keeping you warm, nestling on soft pillows or clean laundry.
The Tibetan Spaniel enjoys any high lookout such as a windowsill from which to survey their territory.
In one compact package, the Tibetan Spaniel is both excellent watch dog and very good bed dog.
Neither nervous nor hyper, a Tibetan Spaniel is like a large dog in a small body. #canine #animal #dog
The Tibetan Spaniel will vigorously alert you to any unusual event or arrival, yet, they do not bark unnecessarily.

Tibetan Spaniels are very sensitive little dogs

column1: Stress Buster Tip - Pop a piece of gum. Chewing loosens your jaw, where you often store stress.
Stress Buster Tip - Sit up straight. When your shoulders are back, you open up your chest and breathe more freely.
Stress Buster Tip - Hang your head forward as if it were a heavy ball, then move it slowly to the side, back, side and front.
Stress Buster Tip - Sing a favorite song. You'll breathe more fully and the increased oxygen will do your body good.
Stress Buster Tip - Copy a cat! Stretch and then shake it out.
Stress Buster Tip - Take three deep breaths-5 seconds in, 5 seconds out-to slow your heart rate and the pace of your stress hormones.

e jealous are troublesome to others, but torment to themselves. William Penn"

Every minute your mouth is turned down you lose sixty seconds of happiness. Tom Walsh
To describe happiness is to diminish it. Stendhal
The secret of being miserable is to have leisure to bother about whether you are happy or not. George Bernard Shaw
Best to live lightly, unthinkingly. Sophocles
Ask yourself whether you are happy, and you will cease to be so. John Stuart Mill
Suspicion of happiness is in our blood. E.V. Lucas
My advice to you is not to inquire why or whither, but just enjoy your ice cream while its on your plate. Thornton Wilder
Enjoy your happiness while you have it, and while you have it do not too closely scrutinize its foundation. Joseph Farrall
Everyone only goes around the track once in life, and if you dont enjoy that trip, its pretty pathetic. Gary Rogers
Happiness is a way station between too little and too much. Channing Pollock
Happiness is to be found along the way, not at the end of the road, for then the journey is over and it is too late. Robert Updegraff
Happiness is not a station to arrive at, but a manner of traveling. Margaret Lee Runbeck
To be happy means to be free, not from pain or fear, but from care or anxiety. W.H. Auden
All happiness depends on a leisurely breakfast. John Gunther
Happy people plan actions, they dont plan results. Dennis Wholey
It is neither wealth nor splendor, but tranquility and occupation, which give happiness. Thomas Jefferson
If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion. The Dalai Lama
Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can only be felt if you dont set any condition. Arthur Rubinstein
Talk happiness. The world is sad enough without your woe. No path is wholly rough. Ella Wheeler Wilcox
For the happiest life, days should be rigorously planned, nights left open to chance. Mignon McLaughlin
What we call happiness is what we do not know. Anatole France
The happiest man is he who learns from nature the lesson of worship. Ralph Waldo Emerson
Happiness has many roots, but none more important than security. E.R. Stettinius, Jr.
To live we must conquer incessantly, we must have the courage to be happy. Frederic Amiel
As a matter of fact, no man can be merry unless he is serious. G.K. Chesterton
The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved. Victor Hugo

Happy is the man who can do only one thing
The first recipe for happiness is: Avoid too lengthy meditations on the past. Andre Maurois"
To forget oneself is to be happy. Robert Louis Stevenson
A reasonable man needs only to practice moderation to find happiness. Johann von Goethe
It is an aspect of all happiness to suppose that we deserve it. Joseph Joubert
Best trust the happy moments  the days that make us happy make us wise. John Masefield
With happiness comes intelligence to the heart. Chinese proverb
Be happy. Its one way of being wise. Colette
Wisdom is the most important part of happiness. Sophocles
Our happiness depends on wisdom all the way. Sophocles
Few rich men own their own property. Their property owns them. Robert Ingersoll
A life of frustration is inevitable for any coach whose main enjoyment is winning. Chuck Noll
The hole and the patch should be commensurate. Thomas Jefferson
Ask yourself the secret of your success. Listen to your answer, and practice it. Richard Bach
A man can do only what he can do. But if he does that each day he can sleep at night and do it again the next day. Albert Schweitzer
Id rather be a lamppost in Chicago than a millionaire in any other city. William A. Hulbert
Nature magically suits a man to his fortunes, by making them the fruit of his character. Ralph Waldo Emerson
We cant all be heros because someone has to sit on the curb and clap as they go by. Will Rogers
A first rate soup is better than a second rate painting. Abraham Maslow
We only do well the things we like doing. Colette
One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar. Helen Keller
Success based on anything but internal fulfilment is bound to be empty. Dr. Martha Friedman
There is only one success  to be able to spend your life in your own way. Christopher Morley
In efforts to soar above our nature we invariably fall below it. Edgar Allan Poe

Choose a subject equal to your abilities
No amount of study or learning will make a man a leader unless he has the natural qualities of one. Sir Archibald Wavell"
I long to accomplish a great and noble task but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble. Helen Keller
The great law of culture: Let each become all that he was created capable of being. Thomas Carlyle
Dont bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself. William Faulkner
Me, Im just a hack. Im just a schlepper. I just do what I can do. Bette Midler
Every person is responsible for all the good within the scope of his abilities, and for no more. Gail Hamilton
Id rather be a failure at something I enjoy than a success at something I hate. George Burns
Im a salami writer. I try to write good salami, but salami is salami. Stephen King
Nature arms each man with some faculty which enables him to do easily some feat impossible to any other. Ralph Waldo Emerson
We do not write as we want but as we can. W. Somerset Maugham
If you have to support yourself, you had bloodly well better find some way that is going to be interesting. Katharine Hepburn
To find out what one is fitted to do and to secure an opportunity to do it is the key to happiness. John Dewey
Everybody undertakes what he sees another successful in, whether he has the aptitude for it or not. Johann von Goethe
Never desert your own line of talent. Be what nature intended you for, and you will succeed. Sydney Smith
The test of a vocation is the love of the drudgery it involves. Logan Pearsall Smith

Brutes find out where their talents lie
Everything keeps its best nature only by being put to its best use. Phillips Brooks"
Genius does what it must, talent does what it can. Edward Bulwer-Lytton
Each citizen should play his part in the community according to his individual gifts. Plato
People are always neglecting something they can do in trying to do something they cant do. Edgar Watson Howe
Skills vary with the man. We must  strive by that which is born in us. Pindar

The same man cannot be skilled in everything
The self is not something that one finds. It is something one creates. Thomas Szasz"
That suit is best that best suits me. John Clark
If youre gonna be a failure, at least be one at something you enjoy. Sylvester Stallone
We would have to settle for the elegant goal of becoming ourselves. William Stryon
You have to deal with the fact that your life is your life. Alex Hailey
Posterity weaves no garlands for imitators. J.C.F. von Schiller
There is always a certain peace in being what one is, in being that completely. Ugo Betti
Your readiest desire is your path to joy  even if it destroys you. Holbrook Jackson
Do the thing you fear and the death of fear is certain." Ralph Waldo Emerson"
Different men seek after happiness in different ways and by different means, and so make for themselves different modes of life. Aristotle
A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature. Seneca
All the discontented people I know are trying to be something they are not, to do something they cannot do. David Graydon
Remember always that you have not only the right to be an individual, you have an obligation to be one. Eleanor Roosevelt
Education should be the process of helping everyone to discover his uniqueness. Leo Buscaglia
I will not cut my conscience to fit this years fashions. Lillian Hellman
Let me listen to me and not to them. Gertrude Stein
It is possible to be different and still be all right. Anne Wilson Schaef
Whats a mans first duty? The answer is brief: to be himself. Henrik Ibsen
A man must be obedient to the promptings of his innermost heart. Robertson Davies
This above all: to thine own self be true. William Shakespeare
If I trim myself to suit others I will soon whittle myself away. Unknown

column1: There is nothing certain about war except that one side wont win. Sir Ian Hamilton

If you dont throw it, they cant hit it. Lefty Gomez

column1: Take time every day to do something silly. Philipa Walker

Showing up is 80 percent of life. Woody Allen

If you run out of ideas follow the road. You'll get there." Edgar Allan Poe"
The power of a mans virtue should not be measured by his special efforts, but by this ordinary doing. Blaise Pascal
Take the time to come home to yourself everyday. Robin Casarjean
We're all failures - at least the best of us are. J.M. Barrie"

Treat your friends as you do your picture, and place them in their best light. Jennie Jerome Churchill
To be social is to be forgiving. Robert Frost
The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for anothers little lapses. David Storey
Sooner or later youve heard all your best friends have to say. Then comes the tolerance of real love. Ned Rorem
The most beautiful discover true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart. Elizabeth Foley
The chain of friendship, however bright, does not stand the attrition of constant close contact. Sir Walter Scott
We should behave to our friends as we would wish our friends to behave to us. Aristotle
The secret of success in society is a certain heartiness and sympathy. Ralph Waldo Emerson
Politeness is an inexpensive way of making friends. William Feather
A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when theyre not so good, and sympathizes with your problems when theyre not so bad. Arnold Glasow
The most called-upon prerequisite of a friend is an accessible ear. Maya Angelou
Friendship is the pleasing game of interchanging praise. Oliver Wendell Holmes
Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the goods and happiness of one another. Eustace Budgell
No man is much pleased with a companion who does not increase, in some respect, his fondness of himself. Samuel Johnson
A friend should bear his friends infirmities. William Shakespeare
No man can have society upon his own terms. If he seeks it, he must serve it too. Ralph Waldo Emerson
We cherish our friends not for their ability to amuse us, but for ours to amuse them. Evelyn Waugh

Wear a smile and have friends
Actions
column2: not words
column3: are the true criterion of the attachment of friends. George Washington"

column1: Confidence is the foundation of friendship. If we give it, we will receive it. Harry E. Humphreys, Jr.
Loyalty is what we seek in friendship. Cicero
The only way to have a friend is to be one. Ralph Waldo Emerson
Good friendships are fragile things and require as much care as any other fragile and precious thing. Randolph Bourne
Friendship is an art, and very few persons are born with a natural gift for it. Kathleen Norris
The support of ones personality is friends. A part of ones self and a real foundation and existence. Katharine Butler Hathaway
One is taught by experience to put a premium on those few people who can appreciate you for what you are. Gail Godwin
Friends are the sunshine of life. John Hay
Of all the things which wisdom provides to make life entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship. Epicurus
Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together. Woodrow Wilson
Good friends, good books and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life. Mark Twain

The bird, a nest
There is nothing meritorious but virtue and friendship. Alexander Pope"
A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend. Henry David Thoreau
One thing everybody in the world wants and needs is friendliness. William E. Holler
Without friends no one would choose to live, though he had all other goods. Aristotle
It is enough that I am of value to somebody today. Hugh Prather
A helping word to one in trouble is often like a switch on a railroad trackan inch between wreck and smooth rolling prosperity. Beecher
All altruism springs from putting yourself in the other persons place. Harry Emerson Fosdick
Make yourself necessary to somebody. Ralph Waldo Emerson
Do things for others and youll find your self-consciousness evaporating like morning dew. Dale Carnegie
There is no happiness in having or in getting, but only in giving. Henry Drummond
The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer somebody else up. Mark Twain.
When you cease to make a contribution, you begin to die. Eleanor Roosevelt

Sow good services
Happiness is a by-product of an effort to make someone else happy. Gretta Brooker Palmer"
No man is more cheated than the selfish man. Henry Ward Beecher
Only a life lived for others is a life worth while. Albert Einstein
If you have not often felt the joy of doing a kind act, you have neglected much, and more of all yourself. A. Neilen
We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give. Norman MacEwan
Doing good is the only certainly happy action of a mans life. Philip Sidney
Happiness  consists in giving, and in serving others. Henry Drummond
An effort made for the happiness of others lifts us above ourselves. Lydia M. Child
Goodness is the only investment that never fails. Henry David Thoreau
There is no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up. John Andrew Holmer
As the purse is emptied, the heart is filled. Victor Hugo
If we had no regard for others feelings or fortune, we would grow cold and indifferent to life itself. George Matthew Adams

Pleasure is a reciprocal
The most infectiously joyous men and women are those who forget themselves in thinking about others and serving others. Robert McCracken"
Happiness  is achieved only by making others happy. Stuart Cloete
An act of goodness is of itself an act of happiness. Maurice Maeterlinck
The habit of being uniformly considerate toward others will bring increased happiness to you. Greenville Kleiser
We cannot hold a torch to light anothers path without brightening our own. Ben Sweetland
He who does not live in some degree for others, hardly lives for himself. Michel de Montaigne
There is no greater loan than a sympathetic ear. Frank Tyger
The only gift is a portion of thyself. Ralph Waldo Emerson
You can never expect too much of yourself in the matter of giving yourself to others. Theodore C. Speers
Two thirds of help is to give courage. Irish proverb
It was only a sunny smile, but it scattered the night. Thus little it cost in the giving, it make the day worth living. Unknown
Charity begins at home, but should not end there. Thomas Fuller
He that has no charity deserves no mercy. English proverb

In necessary things, unity
To give and then not feel that one has given is the very best of all ways of giving. Max Beerbohm"
Real unselfishness consists in sharing the interests of others. George Santayana
Be charitable and indulgent to every one but thyself. Joseph Joubert
Sharing what you have is more important than what you have. Albert M. Wells, Jr.
Time and money spent in helping men to do more for themselves is far better than mere giving. Henry Ford
The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches, but to reveal to him his own. Benjamin Disraeli
Tis not enough to help the feeble up, but to support him after. William Shakespeare
To feel sorry for the needy is not the mark of a Christian  to help them is. Frank A. Clark
Pity costs nothing and aint worth nothing. Josh Billings

Live and let live is not enough
When a person is down in the world

It is difficult to live in the present, ridiculous to live in the future and impossible to live in the past. Jim Bishop
The past, the present and the future are really one: they are today. Stowe
I am not afrid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today. William Allen White
Work accomplished means little. It is in the past. What we all want is the glorious and living present. Sherwood Anderson
It is now and in this world that we must live. Andre Gide
The present offers itself to our touch for only an instant of time and then eludes the senses. Plutarch
One realm we have never conquered: the pure present. D.H. Lawrence
The time is always right to do what is right. Martin Luther King, Jr.
The present is the symbol and vehicle of the future. Joseph McSorely
The present is the blocks with which we build. Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
The present is the living sum-total of the whole past. Thomas Carlyle
Now or never was the time. Laurence Sterne
Act -- act in the living Present! Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Life is only this place, this time, and these people right here and now. Vincent Collins
In the present, every day is a miracle. James Gould Cozzens
One of these days is none of these days. H.G. Bohn
So often we rob tomorrow's memories by today's economies. John Mason Brown
Half of today is better than all of tomorrow. Jean de La Fontaine
One today is worth two tomorrows. Benjamin Franklin
Seize the day, and put the least possible trust in tomorrow. Horace
This is not a dress rehearsal. This is It. Tom Cunningham
The past is the tomorrow that got away. Leonard L. Levinson
The past is one evil less and one memory more. Elbert Hubbard
Our deeds still travel with us from afar, and what we have been makes us what we are. George Eliot
The past is a work of art, free of irrelevancies and loose ends. Max Beerbohm

Yesterday I lived, today I suffer, tomorrow I die

No yesterdays are ever wasted for those who give themselves to today. Brendan Francis
The past is a guidepost, not a hitching post. L. Thomas Holdcroft
We have to do with the past only as we can make it useful to the present and the future. Frederick Douglass
In times like these, it helps to recall that there have always been times like these. Paul Harvey
This time, like all times, is a very good one if we but know what to do with it. Ralph Waldo Emerson
Every saint has a past and every sinner has a future. Oscar Wilde
Fear not for the future, weep not for the past. Percy Bysshe Shelley
Never let yesterday use up today. Richard H. Nelson
What's past is prologue. William Shakespeare
The first recipe for happiness is: Avoid too lengthy meditations on the past. Andre Maurois
I like the dreams for the future better than the history of the past. Thomas Jefferson

We do not remember days, we remember moments. Cesare Pavese
Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another. John Dewey
With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts. Eleanor Roosevelt
Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it. Charles R. Swindoll
Go for it now. The future is promised to no one. Wayne Dyer

Goals allow you to control the irection of change in your favor. Brian Tracy
Strength is a matter of a made up mind. John Beecher

You cannot teach a man anything

There aint nothing but one thing wrong with every one of us, and thats selfishness. Will Rogers
We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it. George Bernard Shaw
In this world we must help one another. Jean de La Fontaine
What do we live for it not to make life less difficult for each other? George Elliot
You dont live in a world all your own. Your brothers are here, too. Albert Schweitzer
The entire population of the universe, with one trifling exception, is composed of others. John Andrew Holmes
When you make your peace with authority, you become authority. Jim Morrison
We cannot change anything unless we accept it. Condemnation does not liberate, it oppresses. Carl Jung
If you want a place in the sun, youve got to put up with a few blisters. Abigail Van Buren
No rose without a thorn. French proverb
These past redress are now with me past care. William Shakespeare
No life is so hard that you cant make it easier by the way you take it. Ellen Glasgow
True freedom lies in the realization and calm acceptance of the fact that there may very well be no perfect answer. Allen Reid McGinnis
Things turn out best for people who make the best of the way things turn out. Unknown
What it is forbidden to be put right becomes lighter by acceptance. Horace
Almost any event will put on a new face when received with cheerful acceptance. Henry S. Haskins
Acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequence of any misfortune. William James
Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst. Lin Yutang
We cannot change anything unless we accept it. Carl Jung
I have accepted all and I am free. The inner chains are broken, as well as those outside. C.F. Ramuz

I not only bow to the inevitable
The mind which renounces

For this is wisdom: to live, to take what fat, or the Gods, may give. Laurence Hope

To live as fully, as completely as possible, to be happy  is the true aim and end to life. Llewelyn Powers #quotes #happiness
Everyone, without exception, is searching for happiness. Blaise Pascal #happiness #quotes
When a man has lost all happiness, hes not alive. Call him a breathing corpse. Sophocles #happiness #quotes
Happiness depends, as Nature shows, less on exterior things than most suppose. William Cowper
Money or even power, can never yield happiness unless it be accompanied by the goodwill of others. B.C. Forbes
The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness shall depend as little as possible on external things. Epictetus
No social system will bring us happiness, health and prosperity unless it is inspired by something greater than materialism. Clement Attlee
The secret of happiness is to admire without desiring. F.H. Bradley
Happiness seems to require a modicum of external prosperity. Aristotle
It is neither wealth nor splendor, but tranquility and occupation, which give happiness. Thomas Jefferson
Happiness is not being pained in body nor troubled in mind. Thomas Jefferson
Laughter is the best medicine. Unknown
Happiness is good health and a bad memory. Ingrid Bergman
The simple truth is that happy people generally dont get sick. Bernie S. Siegel, M.D.
Happiness grows at our firesides, and is not to be picked in strangers gardens. Douglas Jerrold
Family life is the source of the greatest human happiness. Robert J. Gavighurst
He is happiest, be he king or peasant, who finds peace in his home. Johann von Goethe
When men are rightly occupied, their amusement grows out of their work, as the color-petals out of a fruitful flower. John Ruskin
Get happiness out of your work or you may never know what happiness is. Elbert Hubbard
Joy is the will which labours, which overcomes obstacles, which knows triumph. William Butler Yeats
Few persons realize how much of their happiness, such as it is, is dependent upon their work. John Burroughs
Life without absorbing occupation is hell. Elbert Hubbard
Man is happy only as he finds a work worth doing  and does it well. E. Merrill Root
All happiness depends on courage and work. Honore de Balzac
A man is relieved and gay when he has put his heart into his work and done his best. Ralph Waldo Emerson
Happiness comes only when we push our brains and hearts to the farthest reaches of which we are capable. Leo Rosten
Employmentis so essential to human happiness that indolence is justly considered the mother of misery. Burton
Every job has drudgery  The first secret of happiness is the recognition of this fundamental fact. M.C. McIntosh
Work is the true elixir of life. The busiest man is the happiest man. Sir Theodore Martin
To make a man happy, fill his hands with work. Frederick E. Crane

If I were to suggest a general rule for happiness, I would say Work a little harder
To find out what one if fitted to do and to secure an opportunity to do it is the key to happiness. John Dewey"
Congenial labor is the secret of happiness. Arthur Christopher Benson
The happy people are those who are producing something. William Ralph Inge #happiness #quotes
They are happy men whose natures sort with their vocations. Francis Bacon
A mans happiness or unhappiness depends as much on his temperament as on his destiny. Francois de La Rochefoucauld
It isnt our position, but our disposition, that makes us happy. Unknown
A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness. Bernard de Fontenelle
Misery is almost always the result of thinking. Joseph Joubert
We are never so happy or so unhappy as we think. Francois de L Rochefoucauld
He is happy that knoweth not himself to be otherwise. Thomas Fuller
Happiness will never be any greater than the idea we have of it. Maurice Maeterlinck
Happiness does not depend on outward things, but on the way we see them. Leo Tolstoy
The greater part of our happiness or misery depends on our disposition, and not our circumstances. Martha Washington
Unhappiness indicates wrong thinking, just as ill health indicates a bad regimen. Paul Bourge
The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts. William Lyon Phelps
A mans as miserable as he thinks he is. Seneca #quotes
A happy life consists in tranquility of mind. Cicero #happiness #quotes

Happiness is not a matter of events

Happinessis achieved only by making others happy. Stuart Cloete #quotes #happiness
A joy thats shared is a joy made double. English proverb
Happiness is not perfected until it is shared. Jane Porter
To get the full value of a joy you must have somebody to divide it with. Mark Twain #quotes #happiness
Unshared joy is an unlighted candle. Spanish proverb
You are forgiven for your happiness and your successes only if you generously consent to share them. Albert Camus
We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it. George Bernard Shaw

#Dogs and #cats are social animals who crave human companionship. Your #animal companions deserve to live indoors with you and your family.

More than 30 states mandate spaying/neutering of cats & dogs prior to adoption from shelters or other orgs. Helps combat pet overpopulation

Fun dog fact: In total there is said to be around 400 million dogs in the world.

The five basic obedience commands are: sit, stay, come, down and heel. #dog #canine #pet

Dogs need daily exercise, regular grooming, nutritious food, health care, shelter & fresh water. Daily doses of love are important too!

Prepare a disaster plan that includes your pet. #dog #cat #canine #feline #animal #pet

Therapy dogs have been enlisted to help children overcome speech and emotional disorders. #dog #therapy #canine
Over the years health care professionals have noticed therapeutic effect of animal companionship, demand for therapy dogs continues to grow

Children in particular enjoy hugging animals
A therapy dog's primary job is to allow unfamiliar people to make physical contact with it and to enjoy that contact. #dog #canine"
Therapy dogs must enjoy human contact and be content to be petted and handled, sometimes clumsily. #dog #canine #therapy
Therapy dogs come in all sizes and breeds. The most important characteristic of a therapy dog is its temperament. #dog #therapy
A #therapy #dog is a dog trained to provide affection & comfort to people w/learning difficulties, people in hospitals, nursing homes, etc
Therapy dog popularity began to grow in the 1970s as the benefits became more widely known. #dog #therapy #canine #pet
As early as 1919 St. Elizabeths Hospital in Washington DC was using animals (including dogs) in their mental health program #therapy #dog
Pet therapy is a growing part of many health professions. #dog #canine #pet #animal
Keep your dog occupied when he's home alone by giving him a food-stuffed puzzle toy or some tasty chew toys.
Jogging, swimming and playing at the dog park are all great ways for your dog to burn excess energy.
Move it! Healthy adult dogs need at least 30 minutes of aerobic exercise twice a day.
Pets with nothing to do are forced to find ways to entertain themselves. Their choices often include behaviors that are problematic.
We all know, an idle pet can quickly turn into a naughty pet when restlessness becomes overwhelming.
Dogs and cats need to stay busy and engaged, but unfortunately most pets are unemployeddaily they sit at home, chronically bored.
Dogs and cats have other needs besides food, water, medical care and lots of love. They need physical exercise and mental stimulation.

Confidence is that feeling by which the mind embarks on great and honorable courses with a sure hope and trust in itself." Cicero"
Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings." Samuel Johnson"
Self-trust is the first secret of success." Ralph Waldo Emerson"
Our self-conceit sustains
column2: and always must sustain us." Samuel Butler"

column1: Doubt whom you will
column2: but never yourself." Christian Bovee"

column1: A man's doubts and fears are his worst enemies." William Wrigley
column2: Jr."

column1: Our doubts are traitors
column2: and make us lose the good we oft might win
column3: by fearing to attempt." William Shakespeare"

column1: Believe that you can whip the enemy
column2: and you have won half the battle." General J.E.B. Stuart"

column1: The man who cannot believe in himself cannot believe in anything else." Roy L. Smith"
Your success depends mainly upon what you think of yourself and whether you believe in yourself." William J.H. Boetcker"
Experience tells you what to do
Only so far as a man believes strongly
column2: mightily
column3: can he act cheerfully
column4: or do anything worth doing." Frederick W. Robertson"

column1: There's one blessing only
column2: the source and cornerstone of beatitude

column1: It is best to act with confidence
column2: no matter how little right you have to it." Lillian Hellman"

column1: As is our confidence
column2: so is our capacity." William Hazlitt"

column1: As soon as you trust yourself
column2: you will know how to live." Johann von Goethe"

column1: To have that sense of one's intrinsic worth which constitutes self-respect is potentially to have everything." Joan Didion"
He who has lost confidence can lose nothing more." Boiste"
It is proper to have pride in oneself as it is ridiculous to show it to others." Francois de La Rochefoucauld"
Self-love
column2: my liege
column3: is not so vile a sin as self-neglecting." William Shakespeare"

column1: Calm self-confidence is as far from conceit as the desire to earn a decent living is remote from greed." Channing Pollock"
Freedom is not procured by a full enjoyment of what is desired
column2: but by controlling that desire." Epictetus"

column1: No man is free who is not master of himself." Epictetus"
He who reigns within himself and rules his passions
column2: desires
column3: and fears is more than a king." John Milton"

column1: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies
He that would be superior to external influences must first become superior to his own passions." Samuel Johnson"
The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence
column2: but in the mastery
column3: of his passions." Alfred Lord Tennyson"

column1: He that would govern others first should be the master of himself." Phillip Massinger"
Not being able to govern events
column2: I govern myself." Michel de Montaigne"

column1: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving
column2: and that's your own self." Aldous Huxley"

column1: Without discipline
column2: there's no life at all." Katharine Hepburn"

column1: What lies in our power to do
column2: it lies in our power not to do." Aristotle"

column1: I am
column2: indeed
column3: a king
column4: because I know how to rule myself." Pietro Aretino"

column1: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power." Seneca"
Self-control is the quality that distinguishes the fittest to survive." George Bernard Shaw"
A failure is a man who has blundered
column2: but is not able to cash in on the experience." Elbert Hubbard"

column1: Man who man would be
column2: must rule the empire of himself." Percy Bysshe Shelley"

column1: The man who masters his own soul will forever be called conqueror of conquerors." Plautus"
Self-command is the man elegance." Ralph Waldo Emerson"
When the fight begins within himself
column2: a man's worth something." Robert Browning"

column1: It is a sign of strength
column2: not of weakness
column3: to admit that you don't know all the answers." John P. Lougbrane"

column1: If you make friends with yourself you will never be alone." Maxwell Maltz"
It's okay if you mess up. You should give yourself a break." Billy Joel"
The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated." William James"
My recipe for life is not being afraid of myself
column2: afraid of what I think or of my opinions." Eartha Kitt"

column1: Accept the place the divie providence has found for you." Ralph Waldo Emerson"
You grow up the day you have your first real laugh at yourself." Ethel Barrymore"
A man needs self-acceptance or he can't live with himself
Nobody holds a good opinion of a man who has a low opinion of himself." Anthony Trollope"
To love others
column2: we must first learn to love ourselves." Unknown"

column1: Those people who are uncomfortable in themselves are disagreeable to others." William Hazlitt"
It isn't important to come out on top
column2: what matters is to be the one who comes out alive." Bertolt Brecht"

column1: It is enough that I am of value to somebody today." Hugh Prather"
There is a proper balance between not asking enough of oneself and asking or expecting too much." May Sarton"
Striving for excellence motives you
As we advance in life
column2: we learn the limits of our abilities." J.A. Froud"

column1: I hope to work
column2: support my children and die quietly without pain." Sean Connery"

column1: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness." Bernard de Fontenelle"
We would have to settle for the elegant goal of becoming ourselves." William Styron"
Despair is the price one pays for setting himself an impossible aim." Graham Green"
Sometimes it is more important to discover what one cannot do
column2: than what one can do." Lin Yutang"

column1: No man can climb out beyond the limitations of his own character." John Morley"
We cannot all be masters." William Shakespeare"
Learn to  be what you are
column2: and learn to resign with a good grace al lthat you are not." Henri Frederic Amiel"

column1: To dream of the person you would like to be is to waste the person you are." Unknown"
Growth begins when we start to accept our own weakness." Jean Vanier"
The man with insight enough to admit his limitations comes nearest to perfection." Johann von Goethe"
I can't write a book commensurate with Shakespeare
column2: but I can write a book by me." Sir Walter Raleigh"

column1: One must not hope to be more than one can be." Nicolas de Chamfort"
We set up harsh and unkind rules against ourselves. No one is born without faults. That man is best who has fewest." Horace"
Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections." Saint Francis de Sales"
We expect more of ourselves than we have any right to." Oliver Wendell Holmes
column2: Jr."

column1: Change occurs when one becomes what she is
column2: not when she tries to become what she is not." Ruth P. Freedman"

Man has to live with the body and soul which have fallen to him by chance." Ortega y Gasset"
A man can stand a lot as long as he can stand himself." Axel Munthe"
Original Painting - Abstract 2017-47 - 9 x 12" Acrylics on Watercolor Paper https://www. amazon.com/dp/B01N5TNF82/ ref=hnd_sw_r_tw_dp_PjUIybM2NFANM … via @amazon"
To find the good life you must become yourself." Dr. Bill Jackson"
Original Painting - Abstract 2017-46 - 9 x 12" Acrylics on Watercolor Paper https://www. amazon.com/dp/B01N4SCG9X/ ref=hnd_sw_r_tw_dp_KgUIybNKW53AX … via @amazon"
The secret of my success is that at an early age I discovered I was not God." Oliver Wendell Holmes
column2: Jr."

column1: Our entire life  consists ultimately in accepting ourselves as we are." Jean Anouilh"
Of all our infirmities
column2: the most save is to despise our being." Michel de Montaigne"

column1: Do not wish to be anything but what you are." Saint Francis de Sales"
It is better to be hated for what you are than loved for what you are not." Andre Gide"
I'm not OK
column2: you're not OKand that's OK." William Sloane Coffin"

column1: There is always a certain peace in being what one is
column2: in being that completely." Ugo Betti"

column1: There's a period of life when we swallow a knowledge of ourselves and it becomes either good or sour inside." Pearl Bailey"
Resolve to be thyselfhe who finds himself loses his misery!" Matthew Arnold"
All the discontented people I know are trying to be something they are not
column2: to do something they cannot do." David Graydon"

column1: The courage to be is the courage to accept oneself
column2: in spite of being unacceptable." Paul Tillich"

column1: You have to deal with the fact that your life is your life." Alex Hailey"
Learn what you are and be such." Pindar"
I am what I am
column2: so take me as I am!" Johann von Goethe"

column1: Believing in our hearts that who we are is enough is the key to a more satisfying and balanced life." Ellen Sue Stern"
Life
column2: I fancy
column3: would very often be insupportable
column4: but for the luxury of self-compassion." George Gissing"

column1: I am somebody. I am me. I like being me. And I need nobody to make me somebody." Louis L'Amour"
The work praises the man." Irish proverb"
I care not what others think of what I do
column2: but I care very much about what I think of what I do. That is character!" Theodore Roosevelt"

column1: If there are two hundred people in a room and one of them doesn't like me
column2: I've got to get out." Marlon Brando"

column1: Not in the shouts and plaudits of the throng
column2: but in ourselves
column3: are triumph and defeat." Henry Wadsworth Longfellow"

column1: To accept ourselves as we are means to value our imperfections as much as our perfections." Sandra Bierig"
When you know you are doing your very best within the circumstances of your existence
column2: applaud yourself!" Rusty Berkus"

column1: Blessed is he who expects no gratitude
column2: for he shall not be disappointed." William Bennett"

column1: Do not look for approval except for the consciousness of doing your best." Bernard M. Baruch"
What a man thinks of himself
column2: that is what determines
column3: or rather indicates
column4: his fate." Henry David Thoreau"

column1: I have had more trouble with myself than with any other man." Dwight L. Moody"
The worst loneliness is not to be comfortable with yourself. Mark Twain"
A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval. Mark Twain"
Iknow what I do, and am unmoved by men's blame, or their praise either. Robert Browning"
It is not the eyes of others that I am wary of
column2: but my own." Noel Coward"

column1: What you think about yourself is much more important than what others think of you." Seneca"
Let a man's talents or virtues be what they may
column2: he will only feel satisfaction as he is satisfied in himself." William Hazlitt"

column1: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." Eleanor Roosevelt"
You can succeed if nobody else believes it
column2: but you will never succeed if you don't believe in yourself." William J.H. Boetcker"

column1: I care not so much what I am to others as what I am to myself. I will be rich by myself
column2: and not by borrowing." Michel de Montaigne"

column1: To disbelieve is easy
The principle part of faith is patience." George MacDonald"
Our faith trimuphant o'er our fears." Henry Wadsworth Longfellow"
Deep faith eliminates fear." Lech Walesa"
Loving is half of believing." Victor Hugo"
The way to see by Faith is to shut the eye of Reason." Benjamin Franklin"
Faith is a sounder guide than reason. Reason can go only so far
column2: but faith has no limits." Blaise Pascal"

column1: Some like to understand what they believe in. Others like to believe in what they understand." Stanislaus Lec"
All the scholastic scaffolding falls
column2: as a ruined edifice
column3: before a single word: faith." Napoleon Bonaparte"

column1: Your faith is what you believe
column2: not what you know." John Lancaster Spalding"

column1: Faith doesn't wait until it understands
Faith in oneselfis the best and safest course." Michelangelo"
Only the person who has faith in himself is able to be faithful to others." Erich Fromm"
We must have infinite faith in each other." Henry David Thoreau"
Faith has to do with things that are not seen
column2: and hope with things that are not in hand." Saint Thomas Aquinas"

column1: Faith declares what the senses do not see
column2: but not the contrary of what they see." Blaise Pascal"

column1: Faith is to believe what we do not see
Even a mistake may turn out to be the one thing necessary to a worthwhile achievement." Henry Ford"
Some things have to be believed to be seen." Ralph Hodgson"
All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen." Ralph Waldo Emerson"
Faith is the daring of the soul to go farther than it can see." William Newton Clark"

#Dogs and #cats are social animals who crave human companionship. Your #animal companions deserve to live indoors with you and your family.
If you walk your dog at night, stay safe. Wear reflective clothing and get a leash and collar made of reflective material so you are visible
More than 30 states mandate spaying/neutering of cats & dogs prior to adoption from shelters or other orgs. Helps combat pet overpopulation
Fun dog fact: The domestic dog has been one of the most popular working and companion animals throughout human history.
Fun dog fact: In total there is said to be around 400 million dogs in the world.
Don't forget the mixed #breeds of #dogs when #adopting your next #pet . They often make great, loving pets. #canine
Every dog owner should have a leash, a collar with proper ID, food and water dishes and grooming materials.
The five basic obedience commands are: sit, stay, come, down and heel. #dog #canine #pet
When you get a #dog , you make a lifetime commitment to take good care of him or her.
Keep the water flowing. Routinely check your pet's water dish to make certain the water is fresh. #pet #dog #cat #animal
Dogs, as with humans, extra weight can lead to health problems. #dog #canine #animal #pet #health
Dogs need daily exercise, regular grooming, nutritious food, health care, shelter & fresh water. Daily doses of love are important too!
Think about adopting a petyou could save a life! #dog #cat #feline #canine #animal #pet
Prepare a disaster plan that includes your pet. #dog #cat #canine #feline #animal #pet
Make sure your pet is always wearing an I.D. tag. #dog #cat #feline #canine #animal #pet
Contact local law enforcement if you witness animal abuse. #dog #cat #feline #canine #animal #pet
Make sure your pet is spayed or neutered. #dog #cat #feline #canine #animal #pet

The Birman is a medium to medium-large longhaired pointed cat with distinctive white gloves and laces.

Stress Buster Tip:  Accept the things you can't change.  Try to concentrate on the things you do have control over.
Stress Buster Tip:  Try To Be Positive.  Look for the positives in life, and things for which you're grateful.
Stress Buster Tip:  Work smarter, not harder.  Prioritize your work, concentrating on tasks that will make a real difference.
Stress Buster Tip:  Help Other People.  People who help others through activities such as volunteering, become more resilient.
Stress Buster Tip:  Avoid Unhealthy Habits.  Don't rely on alcohol, smoking & caffeine for ways of coping.  Develop healthy coping skills.
Stress Buster Tip:  Challenge Yourself.  Setting yourself goals and challenges, whether at work or outside, helps to build confidence.
Stress Buster Tip:  Connect with people.  A good support network of colleagues, friends and family can ease your stress thru communication.
Stress Buster Tip:  Take control.  Taking control is empowering.  The feeling of loss of control is one of the main causes of stress.
Stress Buster Tip:  Exercise.  It will reduce some of the emotional intensity that you're feeling.  You'll deal with problems more calmly.

Though independent in spirit, Tibetan Spaniels are naturally clean and easily trained. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel enjoys cuddling up and keeping you warm, nestling on soft pillows or clean laundry.
The Tibetan Spaniel enjoys any high lookout such as a windowsill from which to survey their territory.
In one compact package, the Tibetan Spaniel is both excellent watch dog and very good bed dog.
Neither nervous nor hyper, a Tibetan Spaniel is like a large dog in a small body. #canine #animal #dog
The Tibetan Spaniel will vigorously alert you to any unusual event or arrival, yet, they do not bark unnecessarily.

Tibetan Spaniels are very sensitive little dogs
Tibetan Spaniels are small

column1: The Tibetan Spaniel is calm and confident, they're a shrewd choice for those looking for a manageable small dog with big-dog temperament.
The Tibetan Spaniel are long-lived, adaptable companions who form an almost worshipful bond with their humans. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel is a small breed and has a lifespan of 13 to 15 years. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel has a double coat and needs weekly brushing. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel needs only moderate exercise, so they are excellent in apartments. #dog #canine #animal
Although outgoing and friendly, the Tibetan Spaniel may be aloof with strangers. #dog #canine #animal
A very intelligent breed, the Tibetan Spaniel thrives on human companionship and needs to be with people. #dog #canine #animal
The Tibetan Spaniel is self-confident, bright, loving and playful in personality. #dog #animal #canine
The Tibetan Spaniel is ranked as the 120th most popular dog breed according to the AKC. #dog #animal

Why not seize the pleasure at once? How often is happiness destroyed by preparation, foolish preparation? Jane Austen
Happiness consists of living each day as if it were the first day of your honeymoon and the last day of your vacation. Unknown
The secret of being miserable is to have leisure to bother about whether you are happy or not. George Bernard Shaw
Happiness can only be felt if you dont set any condition. Arthur Rubinstein
Enjoy your happiness while you have it, and while you have it do not too closely scrutinize its foundation. Joseph Farrall
Everyone only goes around the track once in life, and if you dont enjoy that trip, its pretty pathetic. Gary Rogers
Happiness is a way station between too little and too much. Channing Pollock
Happiness is not a station to arrive at, but a manner of traveling. Margaret Lee Runbeck
To be happy means to be free, not from pain or fear, but from care or anxiety. W. H. Auden
It is neither wealth nor splendor, but tranquility and occupation, which give happiness. Thomas Jefferson
What we call happiness is what we do not know. Anatole France
The happiest man is he who learns from nature the lesson of worship. Ralph Waldo Emerson
Happiness has many roots, but none more important than security. E. R. Stettinius, Jr.
To live we must conquer incessantly, we must have the courage to be happy. Frederic Amiel
The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence, but in the mastery, of his passions. Alfred, Lord Tennyson
The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved. Victor Hugo
Happiness to a dog is what lies on the other side of the door. Charleton Ogburn, Jr.

And may I live the remainder of my lifefor myself
Happy is the man who can do only one thing
Man needs, for his happiness, not only the enjoyment of this or that, but hope and enterprise and change. Bertrand Russell
The first recipe for happiness is: Avoid too lengthy meditations on the past. Andre Maurois
To forget oneself is to be happy. Robert Louis Stevenson
A reasonable man needs only to practice moderation to find happiness. Johann von Goethe
It is an aspect of all happiness to suppose that we deserve it. Joseph Joubert
Best trust the happy moments . . . The days that make us happy make us wise. John Masefield
With happiness comes intelligence to the heart. Chinese proverb
Few rich men own their own property. Their property owns them. Robert Ingersoll
In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it. Oscar Wilde
The secret of happiness is to admire without desiring. F. H. Bradley
Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage. Anais Nin"
Family life is the source of the greatest human happiness. Robert J. Gavighurst
Get happiness out of your work or you may never know what happiness is. Elbert Hubbard
Few persons realize how much of their happiness, such as it is, is dependent upon their work. John Burroughs
Happiness comes only when we push our brains and hearts to the farthest reaches of which we are capable. Leo Rosten
Every job has drudgery . . . The first secret of happiness is the recognition of this fundamental fact. M. C. McIntosh
Work is the true elixir of life. The busiest man is the happiest man. Sir Theodore Martin
To make a man happy, fill his hands with work. Frederick E. Crane
To find out what one is fitted to do and to secure an opportunity to do it is the key to happiness. John Dewey
The happy people are those who are producing something. William Ralph Inge
Happiness will never be any greater than the idea we have of it. Maurice Maeterlinck
The greater part of our happiness or misery depends on our dispositions, and not our circumstances. Martha Washington
The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts. William Lyon Phelps
A happy life consists in tranquility of mind. Cicero

Happiness is not a matter of events
The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts. Marcus Aurelius"
Happiness is the cheapest thing in the world . . . when we buy it for someone else. Paul Flemming
Happiness . . . is achieved only by making others happy. Stuart Cloete
A joy thats shared is a joy made double. English Proverb
Happiness is not perfected until it is shared. Jane Porter
To get the full value of a joy you must have somebody to divide it with. Mark Twain
Happiness is not so much in having as sharing. We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give. Norman MacEwan
There is no happiness in having or in getting, but only in giving. Henry Drummond
The older you get the more you realize that kindness is synonymous with happiness. Lionel Barrymore
When you dig another out of their troubles, you find a place to bury your own. Unknown
One of the things I keep learning is that the secret of being happy is doing things for other people. Dick Gregory
Instinct teaches us to look for happiness outside ourselves. Blaise Pascal
Happinessconsists in giving, and in serving others. Henry Drummond
If you have not often felt the joy of doing a kind act, you have neglected much, and most of all yourself. A. Neilen
We cannot hold a torch to light anothers path without brightening our own. Ben Sweetland
Happiness is a by-product of helping others. Denny Miller
No one can sincerely try to help another without helping himself. Charles Dudley Warner
You cannot always have happiness, but you can always give happiness. Unknown
In about the same degree as you are helpful, you will be happy. Karl Reiland
No man is more cheated than the selfish man. Henry Ward Beecher
The true way to soften ones troubles is to solace those of others. Madame De Maintenon
The mere sense of living is joy enough. Emily Dickinson
The little things are infinitely the most important. A. Conan Doyle
First health, then wealth, then pleasure, and do not owe anything to anybody. Catherine the Great
Man is meant for happiness and this happiness is in him, in the satisfaction of the daily needs of his existence. Leo Tolstoy
I know well that happiness is in little things. John Ruskin
Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things. Robert Brault
A multitude of small delights constitute happiness. Charles Baudelaire
Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort. Franklin Delano Roosevelt
Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal. L. Ron Hubbard
Happiness is essentially a state of going somewhere, wholeheartedly, one-directionally, without regret or reservation. William H. Sheldon
There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something. Henry Ford
The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose. William Cowper
True happiness . . . is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose. Helen Keller
Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected. George Washington
Happiness is experienced when your life gives you what you are willing to accept. Ken Keyes, Jr.
The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one has to do. James M. Barrie
The busiest man is the happiest man. Sir Theodore Martin
To fill the hour, and leave no crevice . . . that is happiness. Ralph Waldo Emerson
If only wed stop trying to be happy wed have a pretty good time. Edith Wharton
Happiness is often the result of being too busy to be miserable. Unknown
Happiness is not a horse, you cannot harness it. Chinese proverb
Happiness sneaks in through a door you didnt know you left open. John Barrymore
They seemed to come suddenly upon happiness as if they had surprised a butterfly in the winter woods. Edith Wharton
One must never look for happiness: one meets it by the way. Isabelle Eberhardt

Happiness is not a goal
Happiness is mostly a by-product of doing what makes us feel fulfilled. Dr. Benjamin Spock"
Enjoyment is not a goal, it is a feeling that accompanies important ongoing activity. Paul Goodman
Seek to do good, and you will find that happiness will run after you. James Freeman Clarke
Those who seek happiness miss it, and those who discuss it, lack it. Holbrook Jackson
The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness. Eric Hoffer
That kind of life is most happy which affords us most opportunities of gaining our own esteem. Samuel Johnson
It is necessary to the happiness of man that he be mentally faithful to himself. Thomas Paine
The principles we live by, in business and in social life, are the most important part of happiness. Harry Harrison
There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do. Freya Stark
Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony. Mahatma Gandhi
What can be added to the happiness of man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience? Adam Smith
